Recent updates in NYC include a police rescue of a suicidal teen from the Harlem River, the declaration of a 'code blue' for homeless outreach amid freezing temperatures, and the approval of a proposal to expand a sports complex while protecting forest land.

### Risks & Alerts

- Cops save suicidal girl, 16, who jumped in freezing Harlem River. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMinAFBVV95cUxOTDBtSmxnVWdKZ0EzOTBlUVZIM09xNHM0LWhyaGc1ZV9xUlZISjZkNHFTVDg4U0l3UTg4WmQzaTZZWGlZZTNHQ2VLdERhZUp6eUpuQ0FhZ2szUW5hQnRHVEhsaFlwSDlZdG5ORUZ3dzM3dm9zSDNFYmJqdmpPU2tINnloQTllTmFvWWpEWV85WlU1aDgzMlk3NXFqMWk?oc=5)
- NYC declares 'code blue' for homeless outreach due to freezing wind chills in forecast. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMisAFBVV95cUxOZlVXZ2d0ZEdvazlZY1JOX3M0OXZzUk10c3ZkZV8xcElvWVJFZFFNUTBlckZFMW91dXJJaGFhVDhzM05tc0pzcFdlWlhQVFlsSGs4U1BkV1FjY2tkTFJCTnBrUWJWSGVyVjR1aTRGYUQ0aDZlR0RpVnN6ZmVHWlJwYnRPblY5bTZpUXJaT2l0YWhrVDlMYkpWWWVRMm4wTG9sVDRWeDJHMEVnYUpxYlU5YQ?oc=5)
